__meta__.title: Prompt Test Set for Image Generation Models
__meta__.purpose: Diagnostic evaluation of image generation models via isolated behavioral prompts and explicit grading criteria.
design_principles: Behavioral, not mechanistic: assessed capabilities must be directly observable; avoid claims about model internals.
Falsifiable and concrete: each prompt admits clear success/failure cases with operational checks.
Separation of concerns: feature_assessed (observable capability) ≠ what_it_reveals (interpretation) ≠ grading_criteria (scoring procedure).
Overlap without redundancy: prompts may share capability tags but must differ in stress pattern/constraints/failure signatures.
Interpretability over coverage: prefer fewer well-isolated prompts to broad ambiguous ones.

governance_rules.capability_tags: Use 1–3 terms from controlled_vocabulary; first tag is primary.
governance_rules.adding_new_terms: Add only when no existing term fits; document rationale and version the vocabulary.
governance_rules.grading_independence: grading_criteria must be sufficient to score an image without reading feature_assessed or what_it_reveals.

field_semantics.prompt_name: Short stable identifier for the test.
field_semantics.prompt: Exact prompt text supplied to the model.
field_semantics.capability_tags: Controlled vocabulary terms indicating the behavioral capabilities probed.
field_semantics.feature_assessed: Concrete observable capability required for success; phrased behaviorally.
field_semantics.what_it_reveals: Interpretive meaning of success/failure; abstracts above prompt specifics and grading mechanics.
field_semantics.grading_criteria: Prompt-specific grading rules supplying only concrete checks, failure modes, and rubric text.

evaluation_procedure: Check hard_fail_conditions; if any are met, apply the associated score cap.
Verify required_checks to determine which prompt constraints are satisfied.
Detect failure_modes and apply the most severe applicable score cap.
Select the highest scoring_rubric value that does not exceed the active score cap.

grading_components.hard_fail_conditions: Binary violations of explicitly stated core prompt constraints.
grading_components.required_checks: Observable elements, relations, or properties explicitly demanded by the prompt.
grading_components.failure_modes: Recognizable degradation patterns grouped by severity level.

score_meanings.5: Complete success under all specified constraints; no meaningful degradation.
score_meanings.4: Minor degradation that does not violate core constraints.
score_meanings.3: Partial success with ambiguity, inconsistency, or weakened constraint satisfaction.
score_meanings.2: Major breakdown of required structure, logic, or identity.
score_meanings.1: Failure of the core task or collapse of required elements.

Structural Preservation.definition: Maintaining discrete objects or parts without collapse as global appearance or rendering conditions vary.

Relational Consistency.definition: Respecting explicit relationships between objects (spatial placement, containment, ordering, separation).
Relational Consistency.excludes: General scene plausibility without specified constraints.

Identity Persistence.definition: Preserving the same object or symbol identity across contexts, transformations, or repeated depictions.
Identity Persistence.excludes: Maintaining only broad category similarity without matching defining attributes.

Geometric Consistency.definition: Producing mutually consistent viewpoints, reflections, and projections that agree with a single coherent geometry.
Geometric Consistency.excludes: Local plausibility that contradicts global scene geometry.

High-Frequency Detail Fidelity.definition: Rendering non-repetitive fine detail and micro-structure instead of blur, noise, or tiled textures.
High-Frequency Detail Fidelity.excludes: Medium-frequency patterns or general sharpness without structural variation.

Symbolic Exactness.definition: Producing exact, legible symbols (especially text) with correct spelling and stable character shapes.
Symbolic Exactness.excludes: Approximate lettering that is suggestive but incorrect.

Physical Interaction Coherence.definition: Depicting plausible contact, motion, and interaction between parts and objects.

Light–Material Plausibility.definition: Rendering light behavior consistent with material properties.
Light–Material Plausibility.excludes: Stylized lighting effects not grounded in geometry or materials.

prompts.feature_assessed: Maintaining discrete object structure and material appearance while smooth global visual transformations vary brightness, sharpness, and color
prompts.prompt:
A grid of glass squares framed in golden-colored borders.
From top to bottom, there is a uniform vertical color gradient where the squares gradually and uniformly transition from blue at the top to yellow at the bottom.
From left to right, there is a uniform horizontal gradient where the image becomes progressively brighter and fuzzier.
The grid of squares, their borders, and their alignment remain distinguishable across the entire image.
prompts.what_it_reveals: Indicates whether the model can apply continuous global effects without collapsing distinct objects into texture, noise, or inconsistent attributes as visual complexity increases.

hard_fail_conditions: Grid structure is absent or collapses into a non-grid pattern
Blue and yellow are not both present in the squares
Golden borders are missing on most squares

scoring_rubric.5: Structure and gradients remain clear across entire image.

prompts.feature_assessed: Respecting multiple explicit spatial, containment, and ordering relationships within a single scene
prompts.prompt:
A small red cube sits on top of a large blue sphere, which is inside a transparent glass box.
The glass box rests on a wooden table.
A green cylinder is partially behind the box but not touching it.
A yellow pyramid sits to the left of the box, outside it.
All objects are solid, non-floating, correctly scaled, and clearly separated.
prompts.what_it_reveals: Shows whether spatial relationships are treated as hard constraints or loosely satisfied descriptions.

prompts.feature_assessed: Rendering non-repetitive high-frequency surface detail under extreme magnification
prompts.prompt: An extreme macro close-up of a dragonfly's wing showing iridescent microscopic hexagonal cells with slight variation. Tiny dew drops refract the underlying pattern.
prompts.what_it_reveals: Whether fine structural variation is preserved or replaced by blur or tiling.

prompts.feature_assessed: Producing exact, legible text with stable character identity across transformations
prompts.prompt: A neon sign reading 'NEURO-DYNAMICS' reflected in a wet puddle.
prompts.what_it_reveals: Whether text is generated symbolically or as approximate texture.

prompts.feature_assessed: Maintaining anatomically correct parts and physically coherent interactions
prompts.prompt: A close-up of hands knitting with needles and yarn.
prompts.what_it_reveals: Whether anatomy and interaction are modeled as structured systems.

prompts.feature_assessed: Maintaining consistent object identity across divergent contexts
prompts.prompt: Split-screen: steampunk scientist and futuristic astronaut holding the same distinctive compass.
prompts.what_it_reveals: Whether object identity persists across stylistic shifts.

prompts.feature_assessed: Producing physically plausible light behavior in transparent materials
prompts.prompt: Macro photograph of a glass of iced water with lemon producing caustics.
prompts.what_it_reveals: Whether light–material interaction is physically grounded.

prompts.feature_assessed: Maintaining geometrically consistent reflections and viewpoints
prompts.prompt: Isometric room with mirrors reflecting an asymmetric engine.
